solution_line_template: 1. Tonya sold ${small_lemonade_sales} worth of small lemonades and ${medium_lemonade_sales} worth of medium lemonades which makes ${small_lemonade_sales} + ${medium_lemonade_sales}= $<<{small_lemonade_sales}+{medium_lemonade_sales}={total_small_medium_sales}>>{total_small_medium_sales} for small and medium lemonades.

2. Tonya made a total of ${total_sales}. If she made ${total_small_medium_sales} selling the two smaller sizes and she sold three sizes in all then ${total_sales}-${total_small_medium_sales}= $<<{total_sales}-{total_small_medium_sales}={large_lemonade_sales}>>{large_lemonade_sales} worth of large lemonades.

3. The large lemonades sold for ${price_per_large_cup} each and Tonya sold ${large_lemonade_sales} worth of large lemonades which means she sold ${large_lemonade_sales}/${price_per_large_cup}=<<{large_lemonade_sales}/{price_per_large_cup}={num_large_cups_sold}>>{num_large_cups_sold} large cups of lemonade.
